attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies this object.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of the test.

element.name: AssessmentProvider
element.desc: Identifies the provider or publisher of the assessment.

element.name: AssessmentItemBanks
element.desc: Assessments may be part of one or more item banks.

element.name: AssessmentSubjects
element.desc: The assessment may be designed to measure specific subject areas. Note that grade levels are also included in the Assessment Form object. Specific forms of an assessment may have more granularity.

element.name: AssessmentGradeLevels
element.desc: The assessment may be designed for specific grade levels. Note that grade levels are also included in the Assessment Form object. Specific forms of an assessment may have more granularity.

element.name: AssessmentLanguages
element.desc: The assessment may be available in multiple languages. This list will indicate which languages are available.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefIds
element.desc: This list identifies all learning standards that may be measured by this assessment

element.name: AssessmentItemBank
element.desc: A wrapper for the Item Bank elements.

element.name: AssessmentItemBankId
element.desc: If the assessment is provided with an item bank, then this identifies the item bank: a unique code or number used by the item banking system.

element.name: AssessmentItemBankName
element.desc: If the assessment is provided with an item bank, then this is the name of the item bank.

object.name: AssessmentIdentifiers
object.desc: A list of all assessment identifiers that may be associated with this assessment.

object.name: AssessmentIdentifier

attribute.name: AssessmentIdType
attribute.desc: The Id Type Codes indicate the authority that maintains and/or uses the identifier.

object.desc: The state, local or publisher unique Id for the assessment.

value.name: CLIENT
value.desc: Assigned by the client, e.g., a state.

value.name: PUBLISHER
value.desc: Assigned by the owner of the test

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies this object.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of the test.

element.name: AssessmentId
element.desc: The state, local or publisher unique ID for the assessment.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

element.name: AdministrationName
element.desc: Name of the administration.

element.name: AdministrationCode
element.desc: A code associated with the administration. Typically assigned by the assessment program.

element.name: StartDateTime
element.desc: Date and time testing begins.

element.name: FinishDateTime
element.desc: Date and time testing ends.

element.name: AdministrationAssessments
element.desc: A list of all assessements to be administered in this administration.

element.name: OrganizationsSif3
element.desc: LEAs and/or schools that are participating in this administration. If there are restrictions on which LEAs or Schools are participating in the administration, then this list will identify those that can participate. If no list provided, all LEAs and schools can participate.

element.name: AdministrationAssessment
element.desc: The RedId of the assessment related to this administration.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school district associated with the administration.

element.name: SchoolInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school associated with the administration.

object.name: AssessmentAdministration
object.desc: This object represents an assessment event. It includes information related to the time of administration, place of administration, and unusual events related to the administration.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: AssessmentFormRefId
attribute.desc: The RefId of the assessment form used in the assessment administration.

element.name: AdministrationDateTime
element.desc: Date and time the test is scheduled to be given.

element.name: StartDateTime
element.desc: Date and time testing begins.

element.name: FinishDateTime
element.desc: Date and time testing ends.

element.name: DueDateTime
element.desc: Date and time test is due.

element.name: Address
element.desc: Address of the location where the administration takes place.

element.name: StaffPersonalRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a staff person associated with the administration.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school district associated with the administration.

element.name: SchoolInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school associated with the administration.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of this object.

element.name: AssetVersion
element.desc: Identifies the version of the asset that this object represents. New versions of the asset will generate new RefIds and therefore new instances of the object. The format of the version number is defined by the assessment provider.

element.name: AssetPublishDate
element.desc: The date that this version of the asset was published (published means made available for use). If the AssetVersion is provided, then this date should also be provided.

element.name: AssetIdentifiers
element.desc: If the authoring system provides for a unique coding system for assets then this element is used to store that information.

element.name: AssetOwner
element.desc: The name of the owner (publisher) of the asset.

element.name: AssetSubjects
element.desc: This will list all subjects to which this asset can be applied.

element.name: AssestGadeLevels
element.desc: The grade levels to which this asset can be applied.

element.name: AssetLanguage
element.desc: The language in which this asset is written (if applicable).

element.name: AssetLearningStandards
element.desc: A list of LearningStandardItem RefIds.

element.name: AssetContent
element.desc: Contains the actual asset content. Content could be text, images, audio/video, interactive tools, etc.

element.name: AssetIdentifier
element.desc: The identifier for this asset

value.name: INTERNAL
value.desc: provided by an internal assessment service

element.name: AssetLearningStandard
element.desc: The RefId of a specific learning standard for the asset. If the asset is linked to all children learning standards in a hierarchy, then the parent learning standard should also be linked.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: AssessmentRefId
attribute.desc: The RefId of the assessment related to this form.

element.name: AssessmentType
element.desc: Indicates whether this assessment (form) is a standard administration or alternate.

element.name: FormName
element.desc: Text description for this particular arrangement of questions, etc.

element.name: Level
element.desc: Indicates the level of the form.

element.name: Period
element.desc: The time period in which the form is intended to be administered.

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: Grade levels this assessment is designed to evaluate.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentForm
object.desc: Represents the unique set of questions or stimuli that can be given to a set of test takers. A physical correlate of the assessment form is the test booklet given to students during an assessment. For an adaptive test, the form would become a container for the structure and pool of items that are available to be selected by the adaptive algorithm. However, this object does not contain the questions, it only contains elements that describe the form for use in scoring the questions.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: AssessmentRefId
attribute.desc: The RefId of the assessment related to this form.

element.name: FormVersion
element.desc: This is the version of the form that this object represents. Note that new versions of forms must generate new RefIds and therefore a new form object. The format of the version numbering system is determined by the assessment provider.

element.name: FormPublishDate
element.desc: This is the date that this version of the form was published (published means made available for use). If a FormVersion is provided, then this element should also be provided.

element.name: AssessmentType
element.desc: Indicates whether this assessment (form) is a standard administration or alternate.

element.name: FormName
element.desc: Text description for this particular arrangement of questions, etc.

element.name: FormIdentifiers
element.desc: Reference numbers for the form.

element.name: Level
element.desc: Indicates the level of the form.

element.name: Period
element.desc: The time period in which the form is intended to be administered.

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: Grade levels this assessment is designed to evaluate.

element.name: AssessmentFormSubjects
element.desc: Identifies the subject areas for which the form is designed.

element.name: AssessmentFormLanguages
element.desc: This identifies the list of languages that the form was designed to support. For example, a form may include items in both English and Spanish and the delivery system provides methods for the test taker to switch between languages.

element.name: AssessmentSections
element.desc: A list all sections that make up the assessment form. Sections support form structure and sequence. For example, a form may have section 1 being sample items, section 2 being a short placement test, section 3 being an adaptive section, and section 4 a final survey.

element.name: AssessmentPlatforms
element.desc: A list of all delivery platforms that this form design will support.

element.name: AssessmentAssetRefIds
element.desc: A list of all assets used on the assessment form that are not related to any specific section or item. These are assets that are �global� to the form. Examples of form assets may include headers/footers, navigation tools, formula sheets, etc. that are available to the test taker at all times. This list should not duplicate any section or item level assets if possible.

element.name: FormIdentifier
element.desc: Reference number for the form.

attribute.name: FormIdentifierType
attribute.desc: The Type Codes indicate the type and/or uses of the identifier.

value.name: INTERNAL
value.desc: provided by an internal assessment service

element.name: FormAccommodation
element.desc: This list is one or more of the specific accommodations available. If no accommodations are provided, then this list will not be present.

element.name: AssessmentSection
element.desc: A single section

element.name: AssessmentSectionRefId
element.desc: The reference to an Assessment Section object.

element.name: AssessmentSectionSequence
element.desc: A numeric sequence in which the section will be presented to the test taker. This should be a simple integer sequence number (1,2,3, etc.) but may be other values that can be sorted into sequence (e.g., S-A, S-B, S-C, etc).

element.name: AssessmentPlatform
element.desc: A delivery platform that this form design will support.

element.name: AssessmentAssetRefId
element.desc: A reference to a specific asset used by this form.

element.name: Code
element.desc: Code representing the grade level.

attribute.name: AssessmentFormRefId
attribute.desc: This RefId points to the assessment form of which the item is a part.

attribute.name: ResponseType
attribute.desc: A value that indicates the response type for the item.

element.name: ItemLabel
element.desc: An item number or other identifier for the item. It may be used to indicate the order or grouping of items.

element.name: ItemName
element.desc: Name or short description of the item.

element.name: Stimulus
element.desc: A piece of content to be used by the test taker in responding to the stem. Examples include a reading passage, a video, a diagram, or a picture.

element.name: Stem
element.desc: The question, task, or statement that prompts a response from the test taker.

element.name: ItemScoreMaximum
element.desc: The maximum item score possible for this item.

element.name: ItemScoreMinimum
element.desc: The minimum item score possible for this item.

element.name: PerformanceLevels
element.desc: Performance Levels are an ordered set of categories that indicate the achievement level of a person on an assessment.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentItem
object.desc: This object is designed to allow software systems to provide item detail information such as the stem of the item, the distractors, the stimuli, etc. This initial version of the object does not deal with presentation aspects of the item. Instead it focuses on the item content and characteristics needed to enable interoperability and the usage of item-level information in the improvement of learning and instruction.

attribute.name: ResponseType
attribute.desc: A value that indicates the response type for the item.

element.name: ItemVersion
element.desc: This will identify the version of the item that this object represents. New versions of the item will generate new RefIds and therefore new instances of the object. The format of the version number is defined by the assessment provider.

element.name: ItemPublishDate
element.desc: The date that this version of the item was published (published means made available for use). If the ItemVersion is provided, then this date should also be provided.

element.name: ItemName
element.desc: Name or short description of the item.

element.name: AssessmentIdentifiers
element.desc: A list of all assessment identifiers that may be associated with this assessment

element.name: AssessmentSubjects
element.desc: The assessment may be designed to measure specific subject areas. Note that grade levels are also included in the Assessment Form object. Specific forms of an assessment may have more granularity.

element.name: AssessmentGradeLevels
element.desc: The assessment may be designed for specific grade levels. Note that grade levels are also included in the Assessment Form object. Specific forms of an assessment may have more granularity.

element.name: AssessmentLanguages
element.desc: The assessment may be available in multiple languages. This list will indicate which languages are available.

element.name: AssessmentItemAssetRefIds
element.desc: A list of all content assets that are associated with the item. Assets could include stimuli such as reading passages, charts, maps, etc. as well as supporting material such as formula sheets.

element.name: Stem
element.desc: The question, task, or statement that prompts a response from the test taker.

element.name: ItemFeedbackCorrect
element.desc: Feedback can be provided for the item if the item is correct.

element.name: ItemFeedbackIncorrect
element.desc: Feedback can be provided for the item if the item is incorrect.

element.name: ItemFeedbackHint
element.desc: A hint is provided to the test taker during testing, either on request or upon an incorrect response as determined by the test design.

element.name: ItemScoreMaximum
element.desc: The maximum item score possible for this item.

element.name: ItemScoreMinimum
element.desc: The minimum item score possible for this item.

element.name: ItemRubricIds
element.desc: A list of all rubric Ids for rubrics that may be used to evaluate an item response. Typically used for open ended items (such as essays).

element.name: AssessmentItemBanks
element.desc: Assessments may be part of one or more item banks.

element.name: AssessmentItemAssetRefId
element.desc: Reference to an asset used by this item.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an object instance in a zone.

element.name: ItemRubricId
element.desc: If this item is scored using a rubric, this will identify the specific rubric used.

element.name: AssessmentItemPlatform
element.desc: The specific delivery platform that this item will support.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of this object.

element.name: AssessmentItemRefId
element.desc: The first item in the association.

element.name: TargetAssessmentItemRefId
element.desc: The item being associated to the first item.

element.name: AssociationType
element.desc: Indicates the type of association.

value.name: ENEMY
value.desc: Indicates that the two items are enemies and should not appear on the same test together.

value.name: DERIVATIVE
value.desc: Indicates that the two items were derived from one another (such as language translation).

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The student associated with the registration.

attribute.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
attribute.desc: The assessment administration associated with the registration.

element.name: CreationDateTime
element.desc: Date/time assignment is made.

element.name: StudentGradeLevel
element.desc: Grade level of the student at the time of testing.

element.name: AssessmentGradeLevel
element.desc: The grade or level at which the student is to be tested. This element should be omitted unless the student is being tested out-of-level.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a district associated with the registration.

element.name: SchoolInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school associated with the registration.

element.name: StaffPersonalRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a staff person associated with the registration.

element.name: SectionInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a section (or class) associated with the registration.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentRegistration
object.desc: This object represents the assignment of a specific assessment to be taken by a student. A student will have multiple registrations if a given assessment is attempted more than once. This object will also track testing status information after the student has tested.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The student associated with the registration.

attribute.name: AssessmentRefId
attribute.desc: The assessment that is to be taken by the student.

element.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
element.desc: The assessment administration associated with the registration.

element.name: AssessmentSessionRefId
element.desc: Identifies the AssessmentSession that contains the location and scheduled time the assessment will/has been delivered. The session is likely identified at some time after the registration is initially created.

element.name: CreationDateTime
element.desc: Date/time assignment is made.

element.name: StartDateTime
element.desc: Date/time the assignment actually started. Typically considered the login time. For paper-based tests, this would typically be the date of testing for this student. Note: if the student �pauses� or otherwise logs in/out of a test after starting, this only records the first event. If further detailed analysis is required, refer to the item level details.

element.name: EndDateTime
element.desc: Date/time the assignment actually ended. Typically considered the time the test has been submitted for scoring by the test taker. Likely used for online tests only.

element.name: AssessmentPlatform
element.desc: Indicates if the registration is for a specific assessment delivery platform. Should be updated post-test with the actual platform used.

element.name: DaysOfInstruction
element.desc: This indicates the number of days of instruction the student has taken prior to testing.

element.name: RetestIndicator
element.desc: Indicates if this registration is for a retest (retake). Retest can occur if a student failed a prior attempt and is eligible to retake. Other retest scenarios also can occur.

element.name: TestAttemptIdentifier
element.desc: If the assessment delivery system assigns a unique identifier for the test attempt, then the identifier can be provided. Examples of unique identifiers for paper-based tests are batch/stack/serial and for online tests is likely a unique internal identifier. Used to locate the original attempt.

element.name: StudentSpecialEvents
element.desc: Records student-specific special events before, during, or after the test.

element.name: TestingStatuses
element.desc: Records student-specific special conditions before, during or after the test.

element.name: ScorePublishDate
element.desc: This is the date set by the testing program when the test scores are published. For formative or classroom assessments, this will likely be the date when the scoring system scored the individual test. For summative assessments, this date is likely set for a group of assessments when the processing system releases the scores.

element.name: StudentGradeLevel
element.desc: Grade level of the student at the time of testing.

element.name: AssessmentGradeLevel
element.desc: The grade or level at which the student is to be tested. This element should be omitted unless the student is being tested out-of-level.

element.name: AssessmentStudentSnapshotSif3
element.desc: The status of the student at the time of testing.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a district associated with the registration.

element.name: SchoolInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school associated with the registration.

element.name: StaffPersonalRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a staff person associated with the registration.

element.name: SectionInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a section (or class) associated with the registration.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentRubric
object.desc: This object represents the scoring rubric used to evaluate responses to open-ended items. Rubrics will define how a student response is to be evaluated and what score values should be applied based on that evaluation. Rubrics can be used by human scorers (teachers or professional scorers) or are used to train artificial intelligence engines. An individual item may have multiple rubrics that are used to evaluate different 'traits' of the response.

element.name: RefId
element.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

element.name: RubricVersion
element.desc: Identifies the version of the Rubric that this object represents. Note that new versions of the Rubric must generate new RefIds and therefore a new Rubric object. The format of the numbering system is determined by the assessment provider.

element.name: RubricPublishDate
element.desc: Identifies the date that this version of the Rubric was published (published means made available for use). If a RubricVersion is provided, then this element should also be provided.

element.name: RubricIdentifiers
element.desc: If the authoring system provides for a unique coding system for subtests then this element is used to store that information.

element.name: RubricName
element.desc: Text name of the subtest

element.name: ScoringGuideReference
element.desc: The location where the full documentation for the Rubric can be found.

element.name: ScoresSif3Rubric
element.desc: This list will support the score codes that make up the rubric.

element.name: RubricIdentifier
element.desc: An internal or natural identifier for the ScoreTable used by the assessment system

attribute.name: RubricIdentifierType
attribute.desc: The type of identifier that is provided for this ScoreTable.

value.name: INTERNAL
value.desc: assigned by the internal assessment service provider.

element.name: ScoreSif3Rubric
element.desc: Provides a wrapper for the attributes of each score code.

element.name: ScoreCode
element.desc: Non-numeric score code value. Examples might be: 'BL' = blank 'OT' = off-topic The values for this field are determined by the assessment program.

element.name: ScoreCodeDefinition
element.desc: This provides the definition of the score code or value. For example, if the score code is OT, then this can provide the definition of 'Off Topic'.

element.name: ScoreValue
element.desc: Numeric values for the score code. For example a 4 point rubric would typically have the values 1 through 4, plus zero for no score. The non-numeric score codes will likely have a score value of zero.

element.name: ScoreDescriptions
element.desc: This list provides the statements that define the expectations to obtain the score value.

element.name: ScoreComments
element.desc: This list provides a set of comment codes that a scorer may use to provide further detail/feedback concerning the score assigned.

element.name: ScoreDescription
element.desc: An individual statement that defines the specific expectations that the response must illustrate in order to achieve this score point. This is a complex content type in order to support math or other subjects that may require non-text representations of expectations.

element.name: ScoreComment
element.desc: Provides a wrapper for the code and description pairs for comment codes.

element.name: CommentCode
element.desc: This is the comment code that is likely entered or selected by the scorer and is provided in data files or reports.

element.name: Comment
element.desc: A description of the comment code. This can be used to provide additional feedback to the student for the score they received.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentScoreTable
object.desc: This object represents the score conversion tables to be used by the scoring system to derive alternate values. As an example, it is often typical for a scoring system to convert a raw score to a scale score. It is also common for a scoring system to derive a student performance level on an assessment from a total scaled score.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

element.name: ScoreTableVersion
element.desc: The version of the score table that this object represents. Note that new versions of score tables must generate new RefIds and therefore a new score table object. The format of the numbering system is determined by the assessment provider.

element.name: TablePublishDate
element.desc: The date that this version of the score table was published (published means made available for use). If a ScoreTableVersion is provided, then this element should also be provided.

element.name: ScoreTableIdentifiers
element.desc: If the authoring system provides for a unique coding system for subtests then this element is used to store that information.

element.name: ScoreTableName
element.desc: The user defined name of the score table.

element.name: ScoreTableIdentifier
element.desc: An internal or natural identifier for the ScoreTable used by the assessment system

attribute.name: ScoreTableIdentifierType
attribute.desc: The type of identifier that is provided for this ScoreTable.

value.name: INTERNAL
value.desc: Assigned by the internal assessment service provider

attribute.name: FromScoreMetric
attribute.desc: Indicates the score metric that is being used as the source to derive another score metric. For example, if this score table is using the raw score to derive a scaled score, then this will be the raw score metric (3478).

element.name: DerivedValue
element.desc: This is the derived score value when the from-score is within the range specified. The unit used for this value should be represented in the units reported by the ToScoreMetric.

element.name: PassFailIndicator
element.desc: If Pass/Fail indicators are used, then this will indicate if this derived score value represents a Passing or Failing level.

element.name: FeedbackList
element.desc: A list of feedback that can be provided a student when they obtain this score range.

attribute.name: ToScoreMetric
attribute.desc: Indicates the score metric that is being derived by this table. For example, if this score table is deriving a scaled score, then this will be the scale score metric (3479).

element.name: Feedback
element.desc: This bundles the feedback elements together.

element.name: DiagnosticStatement
element.desc: If this derived score can also provide diagnostic statements to the student or teacher, then provide that information here.

element.name: Description
element.desc: A brief additional information concerning the derived score can be provided here.

element.name: Source
element.desc: Indicates the source of this feedback. Values will be determined by the assessment program.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of this object.

element.name: SectionVersion
element.desc: The version of the section that this object represents. New versions of the section will generate new RefIds and therefore new instances of the object. The format of the version number is defined by the assessment provider.

element.name: SectionPublishDate
element.desc: The date that this version of the section was published (published means made available for use). If the SectionVersion element is provided, then this date should also be provided.

element.name: SectionIdentifiers
element.desc: List of section identifiers

element.name: SectionName
element.desc: If the authoring system provides for a section name then this element is used to store that information.

element.name: SectionItemSequenceType
element.desc: Specifies how items are presented to the test taker.

element.name: ItemSelectionAlgorithmName
element.desc: If the section is a Random or an Adaptive section, then this will identify the name of the algorithm used to select items.

element.name: ItemSelectionAlgorithm
element.desc: If this section is a Random or an Adaptive section, then this will specify the location of the Algorithm.

element.name: SectionTimeLimit
element.desc: "See http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xmlschema-2-20010502/#duration for the format of this field. See http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xmlschema-2-20010502/#duration for the format of this field."

element.name: SectionSealed
element.desc: Indicates this section is sealed, meaning the test taker cannot enter the section until authorized by the proctor.

element.name: SectionReentry
element.desc: Indicates that this section can be re-entered, meaning the test taker can return to this section after they have left the section. A common example of this is a two section test where one section does not allow the use of a calculator and the other does. Typically the test taker cannot return to the non-calculator section after they have used a calculator.

element.name: SectionAssets
element.desc: If this section requires any specific assets that are not defined as part of the items that make up the section and are shared by all items in the section, then they are included here. Examples may be specific tools or informational resources that need to be available to the student such as charts, maps, formulas, etc. that were not defined with any of the items in the section.

element.name: SectionIdentifier
element.desc: If the authoring system provides for a unique identification system for sections, then this element is used to store that information.

attribute.name: SectionIdentifierType
attribute.desc: Identifies the type of section identifier using a enumerated list.

value.name: CLIENT
value.desc: assigned by the client; generally a smart number that indicates grade, subject, etc.

element.name: SectionAsset
element.desc: An item in this section.

element.name: AssessmentItemRefId
element.desc: The RefId of the AssessmentItem to be included in the section.

element.name: ItemSequence
element.desc: If the section is a sequential section, then this will specify the sequence that this item will appear within the section. Should start at 1 and increment by 1.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentSession
object.desc: This object represents a specific assessment event that occurs in a specific location at a specific time for a group of students all taking the same test. It also includes information related to unusual events that occur during the session.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

element.name: SessionName
element.desc: Name of the Administration Session.

element.name: SessionType
element.desc: Indicates the type of session that is scheduled.

element.name: UnusualEvents
element.desc: Special conditions or unusual events related to the session.

element.name: ScheduledStartDateTime
element.desc: Date and time the test is scheduled to begin.

element.name: ScheduledEndDateTime
element.desc: Date and time the test is scheduled to end.

element.name: ActualStartDateTime
element.desc: Date and time the test actually began.

element.name: ActualEndDateTime
element.desc: Date and time the test actually ended.

element.name: Address
element.desc: Address of the location where the administration takes place.

element.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to the assessment administration event that this session is part of. If this is a local-only session, then this reference is not required.

element.name: AssessmentRefId
element.desc: The RefId of the assessment object used in the assessment administration.

element.name: AssessmentFormRefId
element.desc: If this is an accommodations session type, then a specific form may be selected for the session, such as a read-aloud form. This is only necessary if the session is being assigned a specific form and all students in the session must take the same form of the test.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school district associated with the administration.

element.name: SchoolInfoRefId
element.desc: Optional reference to a school associated with the administration.

element.name: StaffPersonalRefIds
element.desc: Optional list of references to staff persons associated with the administration.

element.name: UnusualEvent
element.desc: A text description of the unusual event.

attribute.name: Code
attribute.desc: This is the identifier for the list of unusual events typically defined by the assessment program owner. Typically this is a unique code assigned to each special condition by the assessment program.

attribute.name: SIF_Action
attribute.desc: In a Change event, this flag can be used to indicate an element has been deleted from the parent list container. At a minimum the key for the list must also be present.

element.name: StaffPersonalRefIdSif3
element.desc: A StaffPersonal RefId.

element.name: StudentSpecialEvent
element.desc: A description of the special event. Student special event are different from special events of the test session. An example of a student special event may be 'student became ill' or 'student was detected attempting to cheat'.

attribute.name: Code
attribute.desc: A code indicating the type of special event. Code values are determined by the assessment program..

element.name: TestingStatus
element.desc: Records a single student-specific special condition before, during or after the test.

element.name: TestingStatusCode
element.desc: A code that identifies the specific testing status. Code values are determined by the testing program.

element.name: TestingStatusDescription
element.desc: A description of the testing status. Values might include: Did not attempt Do not score Do not report Duplicate test

element.name: RaceList
element.desc: Person's race

element.name: Gender
element.desc: Person's gender.

element.name: BirthDate
element.desc: The person's date of birth.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of the student

element.name: LocalId
element.desc: The locally-defined identifier for this student.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: The state-assigned identifier for this student.

element.name: Address
element.desc: Address of the student

element.name: RaceList
element.desc: Person's race

element.name: Gender
element.desc: Person's gender.

element.name: BirthDate
element.desc: The person's date of birth.

element.name: Age
element.desc: The age (in years) of the student on the date in SnapDate.

element.name: ProjectedGraduationYear
element.desc: Currently projected graduation year.

element.name: OnTimeGraduationYear
element.desc: First projected graduation year, usually determined when student is accepted into ninth grade.

element.name: GraduationDate
element.desc: Date student officially graduated from secondary education.

element.name: HomeEnrollmentSif3
element.desc: Enrollment-related information for the school that is responsible for reporting the student's membership/child accounting information. This is most likely the primary enrollment site for the student.

element.name: SchoolName
element.desc: Name of the school.

element.name: SchoolInfoRefId
element.desc: Provide both the HomeEnrollment/SchoolId and HomeEnrollment/LocalId elements if possible. If not, one or the other must be provided.

element.name: LocalId
element.desc: The locally-defined identifier for this school. Provide both the HomeEnrollment/LocalId and HomeEnrollment/SchoolId elements if possible. If not, one or the other must be provided.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: The state or province defined identifier for this school.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Enrollment status as of the SnapDate.

element.name: GradeLevel
element.desc: Grade or academic level of student.

element.name: HomeroomNumber
element.desc: The locally-defined identifier for this room.

element.name: FullYearEnrollment
element.desc: An indication as to whether or not the student was enrolled for the whole school year. If the SchoolYear is in progress as of the SnapDate, use the value "Unknown".

object.name: HomeroomSif3
object.desc: The GUID of the RoomInfo referenced by this enrollment.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: The name of the object referenced.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Text name of the subtest.

element.name: ScoreRange
element.desc: The possible range of scores.

element.name: SubjectArea
element.desc: Content area covered by the score.

element.name: GradeLevels
element.desc: Grade levels for which the score is valid.

element.name: SubTestTier
element.desc: An integer that defines the level or tier of the score in a multi-level arrangement of composite scores. Zero indicates the highest or root level.

element.name: Abbreviation
element.desc: This is the short version of the name of the assessment that is often used for quick reference and used in reports.

element.name: Description
element.desc: The description element provides an opportunity to pass additional information about the assessment and also be used for describing elements in a test hierarchy.

element.name: NumberOfItems
element.desc: This element records the number of items included on the assessment. This number may be different than the possible score.

element.name: ContainerOnly
element.desc: Indicator describing the purpose of an AssessmentSubTest as being that of a container for the child AssessmentSubTests. There will be no scores within this subtest.

element.name: AssessmentSubTestRefId
element.desc: A reference to an AssessmentSubTest by RefId.

object.name: Sif3AssessmentSubTest
object.desc: A psychological construct measured by the assessment. Operationally, a subtest is a class of scores on an assessment. Some assessments may have only one subtest or type of score but most assessments measure more than one psychological construct. The subtest can be based upon items in a section or items that are empirically related. Subtests can also be composites of other subtests that are combined using a particular algorithm. Examples of subtests of an assessment are math total, reading composite, total test, and English composition.

element.name: SubTestVersion
element.desc: Identifies the version of the subtest that this object instance represents. Note that new versions of subtests must generate new RefIds and therefore a new subtest object instance. The format of the numbering system is determined by the assessment provider.

element.name: SubTestPublishDate
element.desc: Identifies the date that this version of the subtest was published (published means made available for use). If a SubTestVersion is provided, then this element should also be provided.

element.name: SubTestIdentifiers
element.desc: If the authoring system provides for a unique coding system for subtests then this element is used to store that information.

element.name: SubTestName
element.desc: Text name of the subtest

element.name: ScoreReporting
element.desc: Information about the scores reported about the subtest.

element.name: SubTestSubjectAreas
element.desc: Content area covered by the subtest.

element.name: SubTestGradeLevels
element.desc: Grade levels for which the subtest scores are valid.

element.name: AssessmentSubTestRefIds
element.desc: References (possibly recursive) to other SIF AssessmentSubTests. This enables subtests or scores to be composites of other scores creating a parent/child hierachy. If any references are given here, the score is a composite score (it is a parent). The most common composite score is for total test score. The list must be unique. It is also important to note that composite scores may not be simple sums of the subordinate sub test scores.

element.name: ContainerOnly
element.desc: Indicator describing the purpose of an AssessmentSubTest as being that of a container for the child AssessmentSubTests. There will be no scores within this subtest.

element.name: SubTestTier
element.desc: An integer that defines the level or tier of the score in a multi-level arrangement of composite scores. Zero indicates the highest or root level.

element.name: LearningStandardItemRefIds
element.desc: References to LearningStandardItems that this subtest measures. The list must be unique. If the subtest measures a higher order standard, then only the parent standard should be identified in the list.

element.name: Abbreviation
element.desc: This is the short version of the name of, or code identifying, the assessment subtest. It is often used for quick reference and used in reports.

element.name: Description
element.desc: The description element provides an opportunity to pass additional information about the assessment and also be used for describing elements in a test hierarchy.

element.name: NumberOfItems
element.desc: This element records the number of items included on the assessment. This number may be different than the possible score.

element.name: AssessmentItems
element.desc: This is a list of the items that are used to compute the sub-test score.

element.name: SubTestIdentifier
element.desc: An internal or natural identifier for the SubTest used by the assessment system

attribute.name: SubTestIdentifierType
attribute.desc: SubTestIdentifierType

value.name: INTERNAL
value.desc: assigned by the internal assessment service provider

attribute.name: ScoreMetric
attribute.desc: The metric or scale used to report the scores.

element.name: Minimum
element.desc: Lowest possible score value.

element.name: Maximum
element.desc: Highest possible score value

element.name: ScoreTableRefId
element.desc: This identifies the specific score table used by this subtest to generate the score if applicable. Note that the score metric in this object should match the �to score metric� in the score table.

element.name: AssessmentItemRefId
element.desc: This identifies the specific item that contributes to a sub-test score.

element.name: ItemWeightCorrect
element.desc: This provides a weighting factor for how the item score is used to compute a sub-test score when the item is correct or partially correct. Item weight of 1 indicates the full item score is used. A weight of .5 would indicate the item only contributes one half of the item score to the subtest. A weight of 0 indicates the item does not affect the sub test score.

element.name: ItemWeightIncorrect
element.desc: This provides a weighting factor for how the item score is used to compute a sub-test score when the item is attempted and incorrect. Item weight should be a negative value if the item subtracts from the score if missed.

element.name: ItemWeightNotAttempted
element.desc: This provides a weighting factor for how the item score is used to compute a sub-test score when the item has not been attempted by the student. Item weight should be a negative value if the item subtracts from the score if not attempted.

element.name: ChoiceLabel
element.desc: A choice number or other identifier for the choice. It may be used to indicate the order or grouping of the choices.

element.name: ChoiceContent
element.desc: The text of the choice, such as true, 27, or Important economic and social factors.

element.name: CreditValue
element.desc: A numeric value that indicates the amount of credit awarded for choosing the choice.

element.name: TextData
element.desc: Contains arbitrary text, encoded in UTF-8.

element.name: BinaryData
element.desc: Contains the base64Binary encoding of binary or text data not encoded in UTF-8.

attribute.name: ScoreMetric
attribute.desc: The metric or scale used to report the scores.

element.name: LowerCut
element.desc: Lower bound for the performance level.

element.name: UpperCut
element.desc: Upper bound for the performance level.

element.name: FormNumber
element.desc: Reference number for the form.

element.name: Response
element.desc: Answer selected or student work in raw format.

element.name: ResponseLocation
element.desc: An optional element that contains a URL pointing to the location of the response or additional response.

element.name: ResponseStatus
element.desc: Status of the response.

element.name: ResponseTime
element.desc: The length of time the student took to respond.

element.name: ItemNumber
element.desc: Identifies the item on the assessment by number.

element.name: ItemName
element.desc: Identifies the item on the assessment by name.

element.name: DiagnosticStatement
element.desc: Psychometric purpose or design-related comment about the question.

element.name: NumberOfAttempts
element.desc: The number of times a student changes their answer or attempts a response.

attribute.name: AssessmentItemRefId
attribute.desc: A GUID that identifies the item object associated with this student result.

element.name: ItemScore
element.desc: This is the score the student received on the specific item.

element.name: ItemAidSetUsed
element.desc: A tool or aid set used while viewing the item

attribute.name: LevelName
attribute.desc: The name of the performance level.

element.name: CutScores
element.desc: Score bounds for the performance level.

attribute.name: AssessmentSubTestRefId
attribute.desc: References the AssessmentSubTest that defines the score.

element.name: ScoreValue
element.desc: The value of the score.

element.name: DiagnosticStatement
element.desc: Comment created by any logical analysis of this score.

element.name: Description
element.desc: This is further qualification of a Student Score.

element.name: NumberOfResponses
element.desc: This is the number of responses that are included with the StudentScoreSet.

attribute.name: ScoreMetric
attribute.desc: The metric or scale used to report the scores.

element.name: Minimum
element.desc: Lowest possible score value.

element.name: Maximum
element.desc: Highest possible score value.

attribute.name: Code
attribute.desc: This is the primary key for the list of special conditions.

attribute.name: SIF_Action
attribute.desc: In a Change event, this flag can be used to indicate an element has been deleted from the parent list container. At a minimum the key for the list must also be present.

element.name: SpecialCondition
element.desc: A text description of the special condition.

element.name: Code
element.desc: Code representing the grade level.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
attribute.desc: The administration associated with this score set.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The student associated with the response set.

attribute.name: AssessmentRegistrationRefId
attribute.desc: The registration associated with the response set.

object.name: Sif3StudentResponseSet
object.desc: This object transmits the student's responses to stimuli presented in an assessment. This object contains the raw responses as well as provides item-level scores and feedback to the student based on those responses.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
attribute.desc: The administration associated with this score set.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The student associated with the response set.

attribute.name: AssessmentRegistrationRefId
attribute.desc: The registration associated with the response set.

element.name: Response
element.desc: Answer selected or student work in raw format.

element.name: ResponseLocation
element.desc: An optional element that contains a URL pointing to the location of the response or additional response.

element.name: ResponseCorrectness
element.desc: After the test has been scored, this value will indicate the correctness of the response. This element will be missing if the response has not yet been scored. For open ended items that are scored using a rubric, this value will also likely be missing. These items do not fall nicely into the right/wrong category.

element.name: ViewStatus
element.desc: This element will indicate if the item has been viewed or not by the student. Note this value can only be determined for online delivered tests. Paper tests should not use this attribute.

element.name: AttemptStatus
element.desc: This element indicates if the student attempted the item. If a full or partial response is present then the item should be considered attempted. If the student never responded then the item was not attempted. If the item was answered and then later the answer was removed, then it is the rule of the assessment system that would determine if that was considered an attempt. For paper tests, an erasure would also be determined by the rules of the assessment system (assuming gray scanning scale capabilities).

element.name: NumberOfAttempts
element.desc: The number of times a student changes their answer or attempts a response. For online tests, this would represent each time an item was changed after the original (complete) response was provided and the student navigated away from the item. For paper-based tests, if erasure analysis is performed, this could represent either the number of erasures or be set to 2 if multiple responses are detected.

element.name: TimeOnItem
element.desc: The length of time the student spent viewing or answering this item. Only applies for online tests. If the student viewed the item multiple times, then this would be the accumulated total time spent on the item. As much as is possible, the delivery system should remove inter-item latency or item presentation time.

element.name: ItemNumber
element.desc: Identifies the sequence of the item as it was delivered to this student. For adaptive testing, this is the sequence in which the item was delivered. This should be the item sequence starting at 1 and continue to the end of the test (spanning all sections). This should include all items such as sample items.

element.name: ItemName
element.desc: Identifies the item on the assessment by name.

element.name: AssessmentRubricRefId
element.desc: This identifies the rubric that was used to determine the score that is being recorded for this item response. This is only used for items that are scored using one or more rubrics.

element.name: ItemScore
element.desc: This is the score the student received on the specific item.

element.name: ItemScoreCode
element.desc: This is the score code the student received for the specific item. Generally only applies to open ended items. Values are program specific, but example values might be 'BL = blank', 'OT = off topic', 'FL = foreign language'.

element.name: Comments
element.desc: If the scoring process provides for comment codes, then this list will contain each comment code provided with the item score.

element.name: TraitScores
element.desc: If the item includes trait scores – typically open ended items – then this list will support one or more trait scores.

element.name: FeedbackItems
element.desc: This list will support providing feedback to the student from multiple sources.

element.name: ItemAids
element.desc: This is a list of the assessment item aids that were used (or accessed) by the student to answer the question.

value.name: NO
value.desc: Student did not view the item

value.name: NO
value.desc: Student did not attempt the item

element.name: CommentCode
element.desc: For each comment provided, this will identify the specific code for the comment. These codes will be program specific (no standardized values).

element.name: CommentDescription
element.desc: Allows for the description of the comment code to be provided by the scoring system.

element.name: TraitScore
element.desc: This is the container for the trait score elements.

element.name: TraitScoreType
element.desc: If trait scores are provided, then this identifies the specific trait score that is provided. This value will be program specific (i.e. no standardized list of values available).

element.name: TraitScore
element.desc: This will be the numeric trait score value.

element.name: TraitScoreCode
element.desc: If there is a code associated with the trait score, then this will allow for identifying the code.

element.name: FeedbackCode
element.desc: If there is a coding system associated with the feedback concerning the score, then this will identify that code. The format and content of the code is determined by the assessment program.

element.name: DiagnosticStatement
element.desc: Psychometric purpose or design-related comment about the question.

element.name: FeedbackDescription
element.desc: This is further qualification of a Student Score. If this is a teacher scored item, then this may be comments the teacher is providing back to the student.

element.name: FeedbackSource
element.desc: This indicates the source for this feedback. May indicate if this is teacher, scorer, or system generated feedback. Values for this attribute would be determined by the assessment program.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: ScoreMetric
attribute.desc: The metric or scale used to report the score.

attribute.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
attribute.desc: The administration associated with this score set.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The student associated with the response set.

attribute.name: AssessmentRegistrationRefId
attribute.desc: The registration associated with this score set.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies an instance of the object.

attribute.name: ScoreMetric
attribute.desc: The metric or scale used to report the score.

attribute.name: AssessmentAdministrationRefId
attribute.desc: The administration associated with this score set.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The student associated with the response set.

attribute.name: AssessmentRegistrationRefId
attribute.desc: The registration associated with this score set.

element.name: PassFailIndicator
element.desc: If the score value also determines a pass/fail level, then this indicator will specify the value.

element.name: FeedbackItemsSif3StudentScoreSet
element.desc: This list will support providing feedback to the student from multiple sources.

attribute.name: AssessmentSubTestRefId
attribute.desc: References the AssessmentSubTest that defines the score.

element.name: PreliminaryIndicator
element.desc: If this score is preliminary, then this attribute value should be set. Preliminary scores may be provided for early use by the assessment program or user while final scoring is occurring.

element.name: ScoreValue
element.desc: Value of the score

element.name: DiagnosticStatement
element.desc: Comment created by any logical analysis of this score.

element.name: FeedbackDescription
element.desc: This is further qualification of a Student Score. If this is a teacher scored item, then this may be comments the teacher is providing back to the student.

element.name: FeedbackSource
element.desc: This indicates the source for this feedback. May indicate if this is teacher, scorer, or system generated feedback. Values for this attribute would be determined by the assessment program.

element.name: NumberOfResponses
element.desc: This is the number of responses that are included with the StudentScoreSet. Responses are those items that were attempted (partially or fully answered) by the student and not necessarily the number of items in the sub test (which can be determined from the sub test object).

attribute.name: Code
attribute.desc: A code indicating the type of special condition.

element.name: StudentSpecialCondition
element.desc: A description of the special condition. Student special conditions are different from special conditions of the test.

object.name: ItemCharacteristics
object.desc: This object provides specific information about each assessment item. This information includes an analysis, psychometric measures, reliability and validity information. This item-level information assists in interpreting assessment scores as well as aide in improving teaching and learning.

attribute.name: AssessmentItemRefId
attribute.desc: This RefId points to the assessment item of which the characteristics are a part.

element.name: PercentCorrect
element.desc: Number of correct answers in sample.

element.name: SampleSize
element.desc: Number of total Item exposures.

element.name: SampleDescription
element.desc: The description of the Sample the statistics are based on. May be District name, State or National sample.

element.name: Measurements
element.desc: A repeating group of psychometric measures.

attribute.name: AssessmentFormRefId
attribute.desc: This RefId points to the assessment form of which the item is a part.

element.name: Measurement
element.desc: Container for series of item statistics.

attribute.name: MeasurementCode
attribute.desc: A code representing the type of statistic or analysis.

element.name: MeasurementDescription
element.desc: An additional description of the statistic or analysis.

element.name: ScaleValue
element.desc: The value of the Item based on this analysis

element.name: Min
element.desc: The minimum value possible for the measurement and test design.

element.name: Max
element.desc: The maximum value possible for the measurement and test design.

element.name: Optimal
element.desc: The optimal value for this measurement and test design.

element.name: PValue
element.desc: The percent of respondents who answered correctly. This number represents the probability of the correct response to a question.

element.name: SampleSize
element.desc: The size of the student group that saw the item.

element.name: PointBiserial
element.desc: The correlation between correct answers (dichotomous variable) on this item and total correct answers on the test.

element.name: Biserial
element.desc: Similar to the Point Biserial Correlation except that answers to the item are assumed to come from an underlying continuous variable.

element.name: DiscriminationIndex
element.desc: The Index of Discrimination is the difference between the proportion of an upper group who got an item right and the proportion of a lower group who got the item right.

element.name: CMH
element.desc: Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel statistic.

element.name: MH
element.desc: Mantel-Haenszel statistic.

element.name: ChoiceLabel
element.desc: Identifier for the choice.

element.name: Responses
element.desc: The number of responses.
